title: FIX: Correctly save a ArgillaTrainer + TRL model with peft_config

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: type: integration
labels.description: Indicates integrations with third parties

labels.name: area: trainer
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Argilla Trainer

body:
# Description
If you pass `peft_config` to `trainer.update_config`, then it will currently still save the full (but broken) model with some LoRA (or other PEFT) parts interspersed that can't be loaded again. This is because the `self._transformers_model` was saved, but that model was the original model (e.g. Llama 2 7b) and not the PEFT model, which is created internally in e.g. the SFTTrainer.

In short, this now saves the actual model and tokenizer used by the underlying trainer, so that if that trainer make any other changes to the model, those changes will be saved too.

**Type of change**

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)

**How Has This Been Tested**

Created a new test and verified that there's now `adapter_model.bin` and `adapter_config.json` files after training.

**Checklist**

- [x] I did a self-review of my code

title: [FEATURE] Reduce Docker image built time in CI

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: ci
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Continuous Integration (CI)

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The CI takes around 10 minutes for executing the step building the Docker image because we're using QEMU to build the Docker image for the arm64, and this is quite slow.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Build only the arm64 Docker image only for the releases, as those are the Docker images that final users are using, so there is no need to build the arm64 Docker image for every branch/PR (development environments use amd64)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Create a self-hosted runner arm64 to build the image for arm64, but it's not worth it.

title: refactor: detach remote `pydantic.BaseModel` schemas

labels.name: type: refactor
labels.description: Indicates internal refactoring of the code-base

body:
# Description

This PR detaches the Argilla-oriented aka remote `pydantic.BaseModel` schemas from the local ones, this way there's no need to maintain combined schemas for both local and remote which may be confusing, as we can now maintain separate schemas.

Besides that, in this PR we'll also tackle the automatic parsing from Python dictionaries into each respective `pydantic.BaseModel` schema to allow the users to either import and use those schemas or just use Python dictionaries.

title: :recycle: POC: change components from option api to composition api

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
In order to prepare switching component to vue 3 and having a more concise code, we have to switch component from `option api` to `composition api`

Note:
- to get the value of a reactive `variable` inside the setup hook, we need to pass through `variable.value` (see `questionAreCompletedCorrectly.value`)
- In vue3, bus event have been removed. that's means it's not possible to use `$root.$on`, `$root.$emit`, `$root.$on`.
The vue community recommend to not use bus event
- between Vue 2 and 3, some hooks have been replaced : 
          `created` => `setup`
          `mounted` => `onMounted`
          `destroyed` => `onUnMounted`

TO DO
- [x] Change QuestionsForm and QuestionHeader components from `optionApi` to `compositionApi`
- [x] move business logic inside external composables in the domain application
- [x] replace bus event by shared data 

**Type of change**

- Refactor (change restructuring the codebase without changing functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- Feedback task

title: [FEATURE] Implement `ArgillaTRLCallback` to log generations while training TRL models into Argilla

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: type: integration
labels.description: Indicates integrations with third parties

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In the TRL project, when a generative model is trained with PPO and `wandb` is installed, then "game logs" are logged with responses during training [here](https://github.com/huggingface/trl/blob/3f7710aed73ac19c55d78760b0219ef0a0efe076/trl/trainer/ppo_trainer.py#L1310). With Argilla, we can create a `TrainerCallback` subclass which overrides `on_log` to also read these logs. These can be automatically logged to Argilla, allowing the author easy access to the logs & evaluate them.

Additionally, this is being implemented for DPO as well: https://github.com/huggingface/trl/pull/766, https://github.com/huggingface/trl/pull/770

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I'd like to see an `ArgillaTRLCallback` that automatically logs PPO and DPO generated outputs.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None

**Additional context**
n\a

- Tom Aarsen

title: fix: Python 3.11 support due to `Enum` usage
body:
# Description

This PR fixes a bug related to the `TaskType` enum usage to build the `api/datasets/` (V0) Argilla endpoints, as since Python 3.11 the `Enum` attributes no longer provide the actual value, but the enum instead.

This mainly affects the string replacements such as f-strings, since the value is not injected, but the enum instead, e.g. `TaskType.token_classification` is an enum in Python 3.11 but to get its value one should `TaskType.token_classification.value`.

While string comparisons, dict keys, and any other operator that implies a comparison between a value and an `Enum` is preserved, and the value will be used in those scenarios.

Closes #3686

**Type of change**

- [X] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

**How Has This Been Tested**

As we're not planning to add a Python matrix with the supported Python versions (3.8, 3.9, 3.10, and 3.11) in the CI pipeline for the moment, we've ran the unit and integration tests on Python 3.11, as well as deployed Argilla via `argilla server start` and everything works fine so far.

title: feat(search): Similarity search for Opensearch and Elasticsearch

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: api
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Fast API server or REST endpoints

body:
<!-- Thanks for your contribution! As part of our Community Growers initiative 🌱, we're donating Justdiggit bunds in your name to reforest sub-Saharan Africa. To claim your Community Growers certificate, please contact David Berenstein in our Slack community or fill in this form https://tally.so/r/n9XrxK once your PR has been merged. -->

# Description

This PR includes a bunch of changes regarding the `search_engine` module: 

- The base class includes a new method to tackle vector generation and defines the `similarity_search` method.
- Two similar implementations of the `SearchEngine` class have been included `OpenSearchEngine` and `ElasticSearchEngine`. Since they share a lot of functionality, a common abstract class has been implemented for common code blocks, letting each implementation handle its own details.
- A new way for engine registration and generation has been developed. This new way is based on a class decorator. The aim of this approach is to simplify future engine implementations, keeping the code isolated for each new implementation.
The following example shows how a new engine could be implemented and registered as an available engine for the Argilla server:
```python
from argilla.server.search_engine import SearchEngine

@SearchEngine.register(engine_name="my-new-engine")
class NewSearchEngineImplementation(SearchEngine):
   # implemente all required method
   ...
```
Then, you can use your search engine by environment variable:
```bash
ARGILLA_SEARCH_ENGINE=my-new-engine python -m argilla server
```
The `ARGILLA_SEARCH_ENGINE` environment variable has been added as a common server setting. This is a first approach and may change in the future. This is the reason why I did not include it in the docs section.

Refs #3028

This PR adds back the `argilla database` command but now being a shortcut over `argilla server database` in order to ensure the backwards compatibility before Argilla 1.16.0 is released.

labels.name: type: enhancement

labels.name: area: api
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Fast API server or REST endpoints

body:
# Description

This PR adds the two ORM classes needed for the semantic similarity:

- `VectorSettings` (table `vectors_settings`): containing the information of a set of vectors associated to the records of a dataset.
- `Vector` (table `vectors`): containing the information of a vector associated to a record and certain vector settings.

In addition, two alembic migration scripts have been generated to create each table.

title: fix: `SearchEngine` had num index == num replicas

labels.name: area: api
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Fast API server or REST endpoints

body:
# Description

When the instance of `SearchEngine` was created we were passing the value of the attribute `settings.es_records_index_shards` to both `es_number_of_shards` and `es_number_of_replicas` arguments. This PR fix that and now value of attribute `settings.es_records_index_shards` is passed to `es_number_of_replicas` argument.

**Type of change**

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

**How Has This Been Tested**

In a local development environment:

- [x] Run the Argilla server without the fix and create a FeedbackDataset. When calling `GET localhost:9200/_cat/shards?v`, two shards are listed for the dataset (one primary started and one replica unassigned)
- [x] Run the Argilla with the fix and create a FeedbackDataset.  When calling `GET localhost:9200/_cat/shards?v`, only one primary shard is listed for the dataset

**Checklist**

title: [FEATURE] introduce a `TableQuestion`

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls If you'd like to discuss your feature request or specific needs with our product team, contact Natalia Elvira in our slack community or book a slot with her: https://calendly.com/natalia-elvira/30min -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When editing a `TextQuestion` with `markdown=True` it is rather difficult to properly work with tables. And I want to use this for extractive QnA, generative QnA and things like RAG.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to see a `TableQuestion` with very basic Excel-like editability options.
- needs to be scrollable
- alter individual cells
- we need to be able to add/remove rows and columns
- select one or multiple (relevant) cells 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
`TextQuestion` with `markdown=True`

**Additional context**
Example UI
https://www.tablesgenerator.com/markdown_tables

labels.name: type: enhancement

body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**

The filtering when listing `FeedbackDataset` datasets to be applied in the API-side rather than locally once all the `FeedbackDataset` datasets have been pulled from the API. So on, this implies adding the `workspace_id` param to the `GET /api/v1/me/datasets` endpoint, as well as removing the `for dataset in datasets if dataset.workspace == workspace_id` filtering in the Python client side.

title: feat: ensure alignment between `FeedbackDataset` and `RemoteFeedbackDataset`
body:
# Description

This PR has been created as a follow up on the recent community feedback and internal discussions on trying to align a bit both the `FeedbackDataset` and the `RemoteFeedbackDataset`, so that there's a clear distinction of the local one from the remote, respectively.

Some of these changes imply:
* Add `sync` arg to `from_argilla` to either return a `FeedbackDataset` or a `RemoteFeedbackDataset` based on its value, can either be False or True, respectively
* Add a warning message every time `from_argilla` is called with `sync=True` to state that all the additions, deletions and updates will be automatically pushed to Argilla
* Add the `filter_by` method for `FeedbackDataset` in case users want to use the same methods on both dataset types, but raising a `NotImplementedError` for the moment
* Add the `push_to_argilla` method back to `RemoteFeedbackDataset` so that a warning message is shown to let users know that there's no need to call `push_to_argilla` after every update anymore
* Rename `pull` to `pull_from_argilla` while still keeping `pull` for `RemoteFeedbackDataset` and `FilteredRemoteFeedbackDataset`

**Type of change**

- [X] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [X] Refactor (change restructuring the codebase without changing functionality)

title: feat: update `update_response` endpoint to replace `values`

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: api
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Fast API server or REST endpoints

body:
# Description

After discussing with @damianpumar, we both agreed to update the `PUT /api/v1/responses/{response_id}` endpoint to behave like a real `PUT` endpoint replacing the `values` stored in the database with the `values` received in the request. 

Therefore, this PR updates the `PUT /api/v1/responses/{response_id}` endpoint to do a complete update of the `Response.values` (replace the dict), as before the endpoint was behaving like a `PATCH` endpoint. In addition, the PR updates the validation of the responses given for the `RankingQuestion` when the `status!=submitted` allowing the following response to be valid (missing `rank` in some options, which means the user has not ranked this options yet):

```json
{
    "values": {
        "ranking": {
            "value": [
                {"value": "option-a", "rank": 1},
                {"value": "option-b", "rank": 2},
                {"value": "option-c"},
                {"value": "option-d"}
            ]
        }
    },
    "status": "draft"
}
```

**Type of change**

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

In a local development environment:

- [x] Sending a request to `PUT /api/v1/responses/{response_id}` updates the response for a record (overwrites `Response.values`)
- [x] Sending a request to `PUT /api/v1/responses/{response_id}` and the above JSON payload, the server accepts it and returns `200`

# Description

This PR adds the args `created_at` and `updated_at` to the `RemoteFeedbackDataset` and `FilteredRemoteFeedbackDataset` classes, as well as the properties `created_at` and `updated_at` which are set during the init via a protected attribute and not modified while the class is still instantiated.

This is useful towards the `python -m argilla datasets list` command of the CLI, as those were the only fields that were present for the `TextClassification`, `TokenClassification`, and `Text2Text` datasets, while those were missing for the `FeedbackDataset`, so the generated table had a mismatch between the available information for ones and the others.

Besides that, the `datasets list` command has also been updated so as to use those properties and display the same information as in the other datasets.

Closes #3664

## Side-note

We've decided not to add the request to `GET /api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}` in the `updated_at` property, even though it may be needed in the future, as the last update date may be one but we may have applied changes later on, while `updated_at` will still show the one fulfilled during the class insntatiation.

# Description

This PR adds a new command `datasets delete` that allows to delete `FeedbackDataset`s. In addition, a custom callback has been added for the group of commands `datasets` in which a `--name` and a `--workspace` can be provided to load a `FeedbackDataset` that will be used for an operation. Apart from that, the `push-to-hugginface` command has been updated to display an spinner.

Closes #3691

title: fix: default behaviour for `visible_labels` in `LabelQuestion` and `MultiLabelQuestion`
body:
# Description

This PR fixes the default behaviour for the `visible_labels` field of the `_LabelQuestion` schema parsing, so that instead of setting the default to 20, now it's set to the correct value which is 20 just if not provided (`visible_labels=None`) and `len(labels) > 20`.

So on, the behaviour is explained based on the following scenarios:

* `len(labels) > 20`, and `visible_labels = undefined` -> `warnings.warn` and `visible_options=20`
* `len(labels) < 21`, and `visible_labels = undefined` -> `visible_options=None`
* `len(labels) < 21`, and `visible_labels > 20` -> `warnings.warn` and `visible_options=None`
* `len(labels) > 20`, and `visible_labels < 21` -> `visible_options = visible_labels`
* `len(labels) < 3`, and `visible_labels > 3` -> `warnings.warn` and `visible_options = None`
* `len(labels) >= visible_labels` -> `visible_options = visible_labels`

Closes #3693
